newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end lower after roller coaster day.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end lower after roller coaster day.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed lower on Thursday after a roller coaster ride where thin volumes pushed the market sharply up then down, amid few new factors.
Indices ended lower eyeing Wall Street weakness, dealers said, although they may recoup some ground on Friday. However the tone will likely stay cautious ahead of key U.S. jobs data.
The general index fell 4.01 points, 0.67 percent, to 598.70 and the Ibex shed 57.43 points, 0.84 percent, to 6,810.89.

Iberdrola bucked the trend after its consortium won a bid for Brazilian power distributor Coelba. Shares gained 15 pesetas to 1,725. Endesa, also in the bidding, shed 100 pesetas to 3,200, retracing a climb inspired by six month results.
The outlook remains volatile for the rest of the summer.

"The tone is still erratic and with some underlying weakness, although it seems 6,700 (on the Ibex) is providing firm support," said one dealer. Participants highlighted the lack of final investors, with business dominated by trading.
"We can safely expect this for the rest of the summer, with no significant moves before September when people are back from their holidays," said a trader at a foreign brokerage.
